Posted By: CJM2 (7/23/2010 1:09:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I think the lack of flavor text makes it just that much more cl\*\*\*ic. The point of the m10 text was to kinda say "Hey look, we're bringing back that card from your youth!" which is not really necessary this time around since the card hasn't gone anywhere since its last printing. While I liked the text then, I would have raised an eyebrow if it made it to the M11 printing. And there's no denying that the lack of flavor text gives it that iconic feel.
posts.html:
I think the lack of flavor text makes it just that much more cl***ic. The point of the m10 text was to kinda say "Hey look, we're bringing back that card from your youth!" which is not really necessary this time around since the card hasn't gone anywhere since its last printing. While I liked the text then, I would have raised an eyebrow if it made it to the M11 printing. And there's no denying that the lack of flavor text gives it that iconic feel.

posts.post_content:
What happened to the flavor text? That was like the icing on this cake :| it only gets a 4/5 from me now, I loved the m10 flavor text. I could just picture someone standing on big hill/mountain thing, getting mad and then just starting to shriek at the sky and suddenly a giant lightning bolt explodes from the cloud and impales some random [Kulrath Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kulrath Knight) that happens to be flying around...  
  
M11 lightning bolt is lame :\

posts.post_content: Wizards said that Lightning Bolt wouldn't be sticking around forever, and I can't wait for the day that they decide to rid the core set of such a foolish mistake. Lightning Bolt is an extremely powerful card and its return epitomizes the Powercreep. Wizards' actual excuse for reprinting this was "creatures are a lot more powerful, so we can bring it back." Do they or do they not realize that Magic continuing in this direction is a BAD thing!?!?!
posts.html:
